unnormalised: **Question: What yoga practices can improve overall well-being?**
normalised: **Question: What yoga practices can improve overall well-being?**

unnormalised: Okay, so you're looking to boost your wellness with yoga? Fantastic! It's way more than just stretching; it’s a holistic practice. I’ve been doing yoga on and off for years, inspired by my grandmother in Kerala who swore by it for everything from digestion to back pain.
normalised: Okay, so you're looking to boost your wellness with yoga? Fantastic! It's way more than just stretching; it's a holistic practice. I've been doing yoga on and off for years, inspired by my grandmother in Kerala who swore by it for everything from digestion to back pain.

unnormalised: *   **Sun Salutations (Surya Namaskar):** A classic for a reason. Gets your blood flowing and energizes you for the day. Aim for 5-10 rounds in the morning.
normalised: *   **Sun Salutations (Surya Namaskar):** A classic for a reason. Gets your blood flowing and energizes you for the day. Aim for five to ten rounds in the morning.

unnormalised: *   **Pranayama (Breathing Exercises):** Anulom Vilom (alternate nostril breathing) is my go-to for calming my mind. Kapalabhati is great for clearing sinuses. Dr. Sharma at AIIMS always recommended these to his patients.
normalised: *   **Pranayama (Breathing Exercises):** Anulom Vilom (alternate nostril breathing) is my go-to for calming my mind. Kapalabhati is great for clearing sinuses. Doctor Sharma at A I I M S always recommended these to his patients.

unnormalised: *   **Asanas (Poses):** Trikonasana (Triangle Pose) for flexibility, Adho Mukha Svanasana (Downward Dog) for strength, and Shavasana (Corpse Pose) for relaxation. Don’t underestimate the power of Shavasana!
normalised: *   **Asanas (Poses):** Trikonasana (Triangle Pose) for flexibility, Adho Mukha Svanasana (Downward Dog) for strength, and Shavasana (Corpse Pose) for relaxation. Don't underestimate the power of Shavasana!

unnormalised: *   **Meditation:** Even 5-10 minutes daily can make a huge difference. Find a quiet spot, maybe in your balcony overlooking your garden (or even in your 100 sq ft apartment!), and focus on your breath.
normalised: *   **Meditation:** Even five to ten minutes daily can make a huge difference. Find a quiet spot, maybe in your balcony overlooking your garden (or even in your one hundred square feet apartment!), and focus on your breath.

unnormalised: Remember to listen to your body, especially if you're new to yoga. Don’t push yourself too hard. Find a good teacher in your area, perhaps at a local community center or yoga studio. Many studios offer introductory classes for a reasonable Rs. 500-1000. Consistency is key! Even 30 minutes, 3 times a week, is better than nothing. Happy yoga-ing! May your journey be filled with peace and good health. Just think of the peaceful yoga retreats in Rishikesh, and aim for that inner calm, even if you're just at home!
